item.title: 中国泡沫红茶热潮造就六位亿万富翁
item.description:
大受欢迎的饮料销售商正急于套现，但日益激烈的竞争有可能破坏糖水热潮。【原文：

Sellers of the hugely popular drink are rushing to cash in, but increasing competition threatens to spoil the sugar rush.

】

item.title: 债券交易员提心吊胆，等待日本央行发出购买信号
item.description: 本周，日本央行将召开会议，债券交易员们对日本央行改变购买该国主权债务政策的任何暗示都惶恐不安。【原文：Bond traders are on edge heading into the Bank of Japan meeting this week for any hints of change to its policy of purchasing the country’s sovereign debt.】

item.title: 欧洲央行维勒鲁瓦称石油不确定性不会阻止 6 月降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）表示，欧洲中央银行不会因为油价的不确定性而放弃在 6 月份首次降息。【原文：The European Central Bank won’t be swayed from a first interest-rate cut in June by oil price uncertainty, Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau said.】

item.title: 债券交易商期待创纪录的拍卖，以寻找 5%收益率达到顶峰的迹象
item.description: 随着国债有望在本月创下今年以来最差的表现，大量的拍卖活动迫在眉睫，这将是对收益率在达到 2024 年最高水平后是否已经见顶的重大考验。【原文：With Treasuries on track for their worst month this year, a hefty slate of auctions looms as a major test of whether yields have peaked after reaching the highest levels of 2024.】

item.title: 智利对中国钢铁征收关税以促进当地产业发展
item.description: 智利对该国采矿业使用的中国钢铁产品征收临时反倾销关税，以支持当地濒临倒闭的钢铁厂。【原文：Chile imposed temporary anti-dumping tariffs on Chinese steel products used in the country’s mining industry in a bid to support faltering local mills.】

item.title: 肖尔茨以通胀和就业为由对德国经济持乐观态度
item.description: 德国总理奥拉夫-肖尔茨（Olaf Scholz）对德国的经济前景表示乐观，他提到了创纪录的就业率和因能源成本下降而放缓的通货膨胀率。【原文：German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is optimistic on his country’s economic prospects, citing record employment and slowing inflation thanks to falling energy costs.】

item.title: 戴蒙会见寻求私人资金的开发银行领导人
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）会见了世界银行集团和其他几家多边发展贷款机构的高管，他们正努力将更多的私人资金投入到新兴市场的各项计划中。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon met with executives from the World Bank Group and several other multilateral development lenders as they seek to pull more private money into initiatives across emerging markets.】

item.title: 美联储的预测方法看起来越来越过时，伯南克提出了替代方案
item.description: 美联储的预测和公众沟通模式看起来越来越有限，尤其是在经济不断带来惊喜的情况下。【原文：The Federal Reserve is stuck in a mode of forecasting and public communication that looks increasingly limited, especially as the economy keeps delivering surprises.】

item.title: 澳大利亚将在预算案中下调主要全球经济增长预测
item.description: 澳大利亚财政部长吉姆-查莫斯（Jim Chalmers）表示，澳大利亚将在下月发布预算时下调包括主要贸易伙伴中国在内的大多数主要经济体的经济增长前景。【原文：Australia will cut the growth outlook for most major economies, including key trading partner China, when it releases its budget next month, Treasurer Jim Chalmers said.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织对新兴市场债务重组蓝图施加压力
item.description: 世界金融领袖们正在推动对主权债务重组体系进行彻底改革，这一体系已将穷国拒之于资本市场之外，而中国作为重要参与者的崛起颠覆了传统的谈判方式。【原文：World financial leaders are pushing to overhaul a system for sovereign debt restructurings that has left poor countries locked out of capital markets as China’s emergence as a key player upends traditional negotiations.】

item.title: 乌克兰欢迎美国援助，基辅寻求扭转军事挫折
item.description: 美国众议院批准了 600 多亿美元的援助计划，乌克兰当局对此欢欣鼓舞，但人们关注的焦点正在转移到援助如何迅速送达前线，以及一揽子计划将如何改变基辅的命运。【原文：Ukrainian authorities were jubilant at the approval in the US House of more than $60 billion in aid, though focus is shifting to how quickly assistance can get to the front line and how the package will change Kyiv’s fortunes.】

item.title: 销售放缓、库存增加，特斯拉下调中国和美国售价
item.description: 特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc. ）在中国和美国这两个主要市场下调了价格，因为第一季度的销量令人失望，导致库存膨胀。【原文：Tesla Inc. has cut prices in China and the US, its two key markets, after disappointing first-quarter sales contributed to swelling inventory.】

item.title: 中国是黄金破纪录涨势的前沿和中心
item.description: 黄金今年升至每盎司 2,400 美元以上的历史高位，令全球市场为之着迷。中国作为世界上最大的贵金属生产国和消费国，是这一非凡升势的前沿和中心。【原文：Gold’s rise to all-time highs above $2,400 an ounce this year has captivated global markets. China, the world’s biggest producer and consumer of the precious metal, is front and center of the extraordinary ascent.】

item.title: 新加坡干细胞银行毁掉数千份样本后父母的愤怒
item.description: 亚洲一家主要的脐带血库运营商因处理不当而对他们孩子的样本造成了不可挽回的损害，新加坡成千上万的父母对此非常愤怒，其中一些人现在正采取法律行动。【原文：Thousands of parents in Singapore are furious, with some now pursuing legal action, after a major operator of cord blood banks in Asia irreparably damaged their children’s samples through improper handling.】

item.title: 贸易紧张局势威胁中国股票冠军的崛起
item.description: 中国最有发展前景的行业正面临着西方政府日益加剧的贸易限制威胁，这使得有可能推动中国市场增长的股票前景变得模糊不清。【原文：China’s most-promising industries are facing a growing threat of trade restrictions from Western governments, blurring the outlook for stocks that have the potential to fuel the nation’s market growth.】

item.title: 墨西哥银行行长称墨西哥比索波动不会对物价构成风险
item.description: 墨西哥银行行长表示，墨西哥比索最近在中东紧张局势加剧后出现波动，但这并不影响通胀，因为人们预期该行在即将做出的货币政策决定中将继续保持谨慎。【原文：The Mexican peso’s recent bout of volatility following rising tensions in the Middle East is not a concern for inflation, Banco de Mexico’s governor said amid expectations that the bank will continue to be cautious in its upcoming monetary policy decision.】

item.title: 美联储首选通胀指标将支持降息耐心
item.description: 美联储官员即将进一步确认通胀进展已经停滞，这支持了他们的基调似乎发生了变化，即维持较高利率的时间将比之前预期的更长。【原文：Federal Reserve officials are about get further confirmation that inflation progress has stalled, supporting what appears to be a shift in tone to keep interest rates higher for longer than previously anticipated.】

item.title: 定价完美 "开始解体，债务市场陷入不安
item.description: 本周，由于央行官员对借贷成本的鹰派言论以及中东地区的紧张局势，令债市人心惶惶，信贷投资者受到了经济和地缘政治现实的冲击。【原文：Credit investors got a dose of economic and geopolitical reality this week as hawkish comments from central bank officials about borrowing costs and tensions in the Middle East sent jitters through debt markets.】

item.title: 瑞士央行行长乔丹：欧洲需要改革来提高生产力
item.description: 瑞士国家银行行长托马斯-乔丹表示，欧洲正饱受生产率低下之苦，需要重新思考基本面以改变现状。【原文：Europe is suffering from low productivity and will need to rethink fundamentals to change tack, according to Swiss National Bank President Thomas Jordan.】

item.title: 美国众议院在对外援助一揽子计划中通过新的伊朗石油制裁措施
item.description: 美国众议院通过了针对伊朗石油部门的新制裁措施，该措施将成为对外援助计划的一部分，使该计划有望在数日内获得参议院通过。【原文：The US House passed new sanctions on Iran’s oil sector set to become part of a foreign-aid package, putting the measure on track to pass the Senate within days.】

item.title: TikTok 撤资或禁令法案有望在数日内成为美国法律
item.description: 美国众议院周六将迫使 TikTok 的中国母公司字节跳动有限公司（ByteDance Ltd. ）剥离所持股份的立法纳入快速通道，使其成为法律，并将其与对乌克兰和以色列的重要援助计划联系在一起。【原文：The US House on Saturday put legislation forcing TikTok’s Chinese parent ByteDance Ltd. to divest its ownership stake on a fast-track to become law, tying it to a crucial aid package for Ukraine and Israel.】

item.title: 智利央行行长认为尽管存在全球风险，降息仍将按计划进行
item.description: 智利央行行长罗珊娜-科斯塔（Rosanna Costa）表示，延长世界上最大的降息周期之一的计划保持不变，因为决策者已经将新的全球风险纳入了他们的展望。【原文：Chile’s central bank President Rosanna Costa said plans to extend one of the world’s biggest rate-cutting cycles remain intact as policymakers have already incorporated new global risks into their outlook.】

item.title: 据说合作伙伴集团支持的 Form Technologies 公司正在考虑出售事宜
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Partners Group Holding AG 支持的 Form Technologies 公司正在探索战略选择，其中可能包括潜在的出售。【原文：Partners Group Holding AG-backed Form Technologies is exploring strategic options that may include a potential sale, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 希斯称墨西哥五月可能暂停降息
item.description: 墨西哥央行的一位副行长表示，墨西哥央行可能会在 5 月份的下次会议上一致投票决定将借贷成本维持在 11%。【原文：Mexico’s central bank may vote unanimously to hold borrowing costs at 11% at its next meeting in May, a deputy governor said.】

item.title: 墨西哥谢因鲍姆希望负债累累的国营石油巨头转向绿色发展
item.description: 墨西哥的主要总统候选人希望重振这家陷入困境的国有石油公司，将新的重点放在清洁能源上。但首先，克劳迪娅-辛鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）知道她必须解决墨西哥石油公司 1,060 亿美元的债务问题。【原文：Mexico’s leading presidential candidate wants to revitalize the nation’s troubled state oil company with a new focus on clean energy. But first, Claudia Sheinbaum knows she has to fix Petroleos Mexicanos’ $106 billion debt problem.】

item.title: 德国反对欧盟联合债务既是政治问题也是法律问题
item.description: 德国财政部长克里斯蒂安-林德纳（Christian Lindner）表示，他反对欧盟新一轮联合发债，因为成员国应该对自己的财政负责。【原文：German Finance Minister Christian Lindner said he’s opposed to a new round of joint debt issuance by the European Union because member states should take responsibility for their own finances.】

item.title: 墨西哥总统候选人辛鲍姆讨论特朗普和移民问题
item.description: 墨西哥总统候选人克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）相信，如果两人都赢得各自的选举，她将与唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）保持良好的关系。【原文：Mexico’s presidential frontrunner Claudia Sheinbaum is confident she’ll have a good relationship with Donald Trump should they both win their respective elections.】

item.title: 投资者建议："你需要系好安全带
item.description:
理查德-哈斯（Richard Haass）说，这是一个危险的世界，保持警惕是值得的

。【原文：

It’s a dangerous world, Richard Haass says, and it pays to keep your head on a swivel

】

item.title: 七大华丽财报来袭 股价处于关键时刻
item.description: 大型科技公司的财报将于下周公布，这对那些希望借助人工智能推动下滑的 S&P 500 指数反弹的投资者来说恰逢其时，该指数刚刚经历了一年多来最糟糕的一周。【原文：Big Tech earnings arrive next week, right in time for investors looking for an artificial intelligence-powered rebound in the slumping S&P 500 Index, which just suffered through its worst week in over a year.】

item.title: 梅洛尼债务轨迹恶化，意大利躲过 S&P 审查
item.description: S&P全球评级公司对意大利的信用状况保持不变，这是对总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）政府所预见的债务恶化轨迹进行的首次重大审查。【原文：Italy’s credit status remains intact at S&P Global Ratings, which enacted the first major scrutiny on a worsened trajectory for debt foreseen by Premier Giorgia Meloni’s government.】
